subject: research engineer position available at  isr - university of coimbra,   portugal  on active and healthy ageing and aal in general
content: (please redistribute; apologies for cross-postings) -------------------------------------------------------------------- research engineer position at isr - university of coimbra,  portugal  topics: active and healthy ageing, ambient assisted living, social robots, smart homes, human activity recognition, human-robot interaction. application deadline: january 22, 2018 (hard deadline) -------------------------------------------------------------------- one research engineer position is available at institute of systems and robotics - university of coimbra (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__ap.isr.uc.pt_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=a9yxvauitrefqtclmutshtx1m-iwarh26ukb-i3ch6k&s=0i9hc8mpbrhyttoogukosu2cg4zidac9eaocxenj6km&e=),  portugal , starting in february 2018, under the supervision of prof. rui p. rocha, in the scope of the project ?euroage - innovative initiatives for the promotion of active aging in the euroace region?, with the ref. poctep-0043_euroage_4_e, funded by the interreg v a  spain  -  portugal  program (poctep 2014-2020). the euroage project aims at fostering autonomous healthy life, mainly in elderly people but also in people with some degree of dependency, through the promotion of innovative initiatives based on information and communication technologies provided by the patterns participating in the project. the project involves  portugal - spain  cross-border cooperation of partners from euroace region, a region that covers centro and alentejo regions in  portugal , and extremadura region in  spain , which is a territory in iberian peninsula heavily affected by the ageing of the population. the research team from isr - university of coimbra that participates in the euroage project will demonstrate and validate with elderly people the use of social robots and smart homes as key technologies to promote active and healthy ageing, through cognitive, socio-emotional stimulation and physical activity promotion, thus contributing to quality of life enhancement and increased healthy life expectancy, mainly in the elderly population. the candidates must hold a m.sc. degree in electrical and computer engineering, or in computer science engineering, **obtained in a university located in a country that adhered to the european higher education area (a.k.a. bolonha declaration), in canada, or in usa**. the candidates must have high oral and written proficiency in english if her/his mother tongue is not the portuguese. the ideal candidate would have excellent software development skills in c++ and linux os, solid experience in software development for robots using ros (robot operating system), experience in pattern recognition and machine learning techniques, excellent interpersonal and teamwork skills, and be eager to get involved in the euroage project. application procedure applicants must send by email the following mandatory documents: i) digital copy of the m.sc. academic degree certificate and certificates of other academic degrees held by the candidate (e.g. b.sc.); ii) curriculum vitae (cv), including gpa for academic degrees, curricula of the b.sc. and m.sc. courses, and title of the m.sc. dissertation; iii) motivation letter ? the candidate must demonstrate her/his total availability to start working in isr - university of coimbra on early february. important notice: candidates who did not obtain their m.sc. degree in  portugal  are obliged to present records of the equivalence/recognition of the m.sc. diploma in  portugal , issued by the directorate-general for higher education or by a portuguese public higher education establishment, according with the information at:  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.uc.pt_en_academicos_provas_equivalencia&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=a9yxvauitrefqtclmutshtx1m-iwarh26ukb-i3ch6k&s=q1vm3ponv-o3xj_fkum6x5wnsoojssw5nyiir9r8fo8&e= for candidates who are still waiting for the end of this recognition process, at least a proof that a request for the diploma recognition is being processed by the academic services of university of coimbra (e.g. an email from official services) must be included in the application. the following optional documents can be sent together with the aforementioned documents: - certificates of the participation in face-to-face courses, workshops, and summer schools related with ros, mobile robotics, pattern recognition, machine learning, and computer vision; - reference letters and contact information of current or previous supervisors for candidates having past experience in r&d projects; - other relevant documentation, e.g. a digital copy of the m.sc. dissertation. since the two applicants having the best curriculum will be interviewed in january 2018 before the winning candidate is selected, every applicant should provide the skype nickname in the contact information included in the cv. the application must be sent in pdf format to rprocha[at]isr.uc.pt, with the subject ?research engineer position in euroage project?, *no later than january 22, 2018*. ______ rui p. rocha, ph.d. assistant professor institute of systems and robotics dept. of electrical and computer engineering university of coimbra universidade de coimbra - p?lo ii 3030-290 coimbra,  portugal  e-mail: rprocha[at]isr.uc./ rprocha[at]deec.uc./ rui.rocha[at]uc.tel.: +351 239 796 256 skype: rprocha web: home.deec.uc.pt/~rprocha _______ founded in 1290, the university of coimbra (uc) is the oldest portuguese university and one of the oldest in the world. uc is nowadays a vibrant academy and an indisputable reference in higher education and research in  portugal  and in europe, due to the quality of the courses taught at its eight faculties and to its excellence in the promotion of science and technology advances in 46 research units integrated in the university. with more than 1,500 researchers and professors, uc has extensive experience in research programs with competitive research funding, particularly in european commission (ec) framework programs for research, in several areas including sciences, engineering, health, justice and home affairs, international cooperation, and mobility. in fp7, uc participated in 59 projects and was the coordinator in 10 of them. since the beginning of h2020, uc has participated in 20 project applications that were approved for funding, being the coordinator in 5 of them. the institute of systems and robotics - university of coimbra (isr-uc) is a research unit integrated in uc whose overall goal is to develop excellent research in various areas of science and technology, with emphasis on intelligent systems and robotics. the isr-uc has participated in over a dozen european projects funded by ec. the artificial perception for intelligent systems and robotics (ap4isr) team of isr-uc has participated in several ec-funded projects, both in fp6 (projects bacs and irps), fp7 (projects prometheus, handle, and social robot), and h2020 (project growmeup) framework programmes. the ap4isr team has been doing research in collaboration with important european players in excellence research from universities, research institutions, and companies (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__ap.isr.uc.pt_-3fw-3dpartners&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=a9yxvauitrefqtclmutshtx1m-iwarh26ukb-i3ch6k&s=yct73ovcqhsrsqme1y6yr4eargibvhthuykbbt_tksk&e=), mostly from europe.

subject: (pineapple robotics,  canada) head of engineering,  focus on articulated robotics for fast food automation
content: pineapple robotics is a new company that is looking for a talented and experienced head of engineering to lead the development of a first-of-its-kind technology in the healthy fast food industry.  we are starting by building robots to automate making salads, with the initial high-growth salad restaurant partner based out of ottawa. pineapple hq is based out of toronto. you will be part of the talented founding team that includes: (i) someone who is ex-mckinsey, (ii) the founder of a very successful food retail brand that ipo?d, and (iii) potentially an ex-ceo of fortune 500 fast food restaurant.  we are passionate about fundamentally changing the fast food industry by unlocking latent demand for affordable healthy food through responsible robot automation. as the head of engineering, you will have the ability not only to lead the build of a robot that will touch consumer?s lives in mid to late 2018, but also to build an engineering team. this role is for an optimist and a dreamer who loves building and executing towards output more than anything in the world. job responsibilities learn the business by rolling up your sleeves and serving salads.  eat, sleep, and dream about automating salad restaurants.  be creative in identifying physical workflows that can be automated own end-to-end robotics engineering initiatives from concept to build to launch be tactical. roll up your sleeves, dig in and get the job done early and well internalize the business needs and balance trade-offs to constantly optimize the triple constraint on cost, quality, and time anticipate and mitigate bottlenecks and pitfalls, but continue to build fast and brake things drive technical sessions with suppliers/design partners to track & follow up issues/escalations required skills ms or phd in relevant discipline such as robotics, electrical engineering, mechatronics engineering and mechanical engineering at least 3 years of work experience in an agile robotics work environment preference goes to candidates that can showcase robots that they?ve built, ideally in articulated robotics (initial robot will likely be the ur3) self-motivated and proactive with demonstrated creative and critical thinking capabilities understands rapid development cycles; remains flexible and calm in the face of uncertainty teamwork and collaboration is king. you must be able to dedicate yourself to the team by working collaboratively and prioritizing team effectiveness must be flexible on location for a thrilling impactful role:  based out of toronto, with initial work in ottawa, and potential for some work in san francisco additional information compensation and benefits information lots of equity and sustaining salary for a superstar candidate salary to increase at second financing round career development and training this role is for a self-driven engineer that learns by doing contact information please email bryan altman at altmbr [at] gmail [dot] com with your resume attached bryan altman, b.eng mobile: (514)-594-8623

subject: (pineapple robotics,  canada) head of engineering,  focus on articulated robotics for fast food automation
content: pineapple robotics is a new company that is looking for a talented and experienced head of engineering to lead the development of a first-of-its-kind technology in the healthy fast food industry.  we are starting by building robots to automate making salads, with the initial high-growth salad restaurant partner based out of ottawa. pineapple hq is based out of toronto. you will be part of the talented founding team that includes: (i) someone who is ex-mckinsey, (ii) the founder of a very successful food retail brand that ipo?d, and (iii) potentially an ex-ceo of fortune 500 fast food restaurant.  we are passionate about fundamentally changing the fast food industry by unlocking latent demand for affordable healthy food through responsible robot automation. as the head of engineering, you will have the ability not only to lead the build of a robot that will touch consumer?s lives in mid to late 2018, but also to build an engineering team. this role is for an optimist and a dreamer who loves building and executing towards output more than anything in the world. job responsibilities learn the business by rolling up your sleeves and serving salads.  eat, sleep, and dream about automating salad restaurants.  be creative in identifying physical workflows that can be automated own end-to-end robotics engineering initiatives from concept to build to launch be tactical. roll up your sleeves, dig in and get the job done early and well internalize the business needs and balance trade-offs to constantly optimize the triple constraint on cost, quality, and time anticipate and mitigate bottlenecks and pitfalls, but continue to build fast and brake things drive technical sessions with suppliers/design partners to track & follow up issues/escalations required skills ms or phd in relevant discipline such as robotics, electrical engineering, mechatronics engineering and mechanical engineering at least 3 years of work experience in an agile robotics work environment preference goes to candidates that can showcase robots that they?ve built, ideally in articulated robotics (initial robot will likely be the ur3) self-motivated and proactive with demonstrated creative and critical thinking capabilities understands rapid development cycles; remains flexible and calm in the face of uncertainty teamwork and collaboration is king. you must be able to dedicate yourself to the team by working collaboratively and prioritizing team effectiveness must be flexible on location for a thrilling impactful role:  based out of toronto, with initial work in ottawa, and potential for some work in san francisco additional information compensation and benefits information lots of equity and sustaining salary for a superstar candidate salary to increase at second financing round career development and training this role is for a self-driven engineer that learns by doing contact information please email bryan altman at altmbr [at] gmail [dot] com with your resume attached bryan altman, b.eng mobile: (514)-594-8623

subject: research engineer position available at  isr - university of coimbra,   portugal  on active and healthy ageing and aal in general in-reply-to: <1884206993.870263.1515502533675.javamail.zimbra@isr.uc.pt> references: <1884206993.870263.1515502533675.javamail.zimbra@isr.uc.pt>
content: (please redistribute; apologies for cross-postings) -------------------------------------------------------------------- research engineer position at isr - university of coimbra,  portugal  topics: active and healthy ageing, ambient assisted living, social robots, smart homes, human activity recognition, human-robot interaction. application deadline: january 22, 2018 (hard deadline) -------------------------------------------------------------------- one research engineer position is available at institute of systems and robotics - university of coimbra (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__ap.isr.uc.pt_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=l4eg2gxvqied0jmkzvf3vnarzfaxfgfnpfcllb8i7wa&s=jhtxoohd2v_0bzhqfuk7ria5t7c3hruqaskavvxkxda&e=),  portugal , starting in february 2018, under the supervision of prof. rui p. rocha, in the scope of the project ?euroage - innovative initiatives for the promotion of active aging in the euroace region?, with the ref. poctep-0043_euroage_4_e, funded by the interreg v a  spain  -  portugal  program (poctep 2014-2020). the euroage project aims at fostering autonomous healthy life, mainly in elderly people but also in people with some degree of dependency, through the promotion of innovative initiatives based on information and communication technologies provided by the patterns participating in the project. the project involves  portugal - spain  cross-border cooperation of partners from euroace region, a region that covers centro and alentejo regions in  portugal , and extremadura region in  spain , which is a territory in iberian peninsula heavily affected by the ageing of the population. the research team from isr - university of coimbra that participates in the euroage project will demonstrate and validate with elderly people the use of social robots and smart homes as key technologies to promote active and healthy ageing, through cognitive, socio-emotional stimulation and physical activity promotion, thus contributing to quality of life enhancement and increased healthy life expectancy, mainly in the elderly population. the candidates must hold a m.sc. degree in electrical and computer engineering, or in computer science engineering, **obtained in a university located in a country that adhered to the european higher education area (a.k.a. bolonha declaration), in canada, or in usa**. the candidates must have high oral and written proficiency in english if her/his mother tongue is not the portuguese. the ideal candidate would have excellent software development skills in c++ and linux os, solid experience in software development for robots using ros (robot operating system), experience in pattern recognition and machine learning techniques, excellent interpersonal and teamwork skills, and be eager to get involved in the euroage project. application procedure applicants must send by email the following mandatory documents: i) digital copy of the m.sc. academic degree certificate and certificates of other academic degrees held by the candidate (e.g. b.sc.); ii) curriculum vitae (cv), including gpa for academic degrees, curricula of the b.sc. and m.sc. courses, and title of the m.sc. dissertation; iii) motivation letter ? the candidate must demonstrate her/his total availability to start working in isr - university of coimbra on early february. important notice: candidates who did not obtain their m.sc. degree in  portugal  are obliged to present records of the equivalence/recognition of the m.sc. diploma in  portugal , issued by the directorate-general for higher education or by a portuguese public higher education establishment, according with the information at:  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.uc.pt_en_academicos_provas_equivalencia&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=l4eg2gxvqied0jmkzvf3vnarzfaxfgfnpfcllb8i7wa&s=mtfui7dha0ijpwyo5pwnm-vrr1e5pqtwxdyue-x2ejy&e= for candidates who are still waiting for the end of this recognition process, at least a proof that a request for the diploma recognition is being processed by the academic services of university of coimbra (e.g. an email from official services) must be included in the application. the following optional documents can be sent together with the aforementioned documents: - certificates of the participation in face-to-face courses, workshops, and summer schools related with ros, mobile robotics, pattern recognition, machine learning, and computer vision; - reference letters and contact information of current or previous supervisors for candidates having past experience in r&d projects; - other relevant documentation, e.g. a digital copy of the m.sc. dissertation. since the two applicants having the best curriculum will be interviewed in january 2018 before the winning candidate is selected, every applicant should provide the skype nickname in the contact information included in the cv. the application must be sent in pdf format to rprocha[at]isr.uc.pt, with the subject ?research engineer position in euroage project?, *no later than january 22, 2018*. ______ rui p. rocha, ph.d. assistant professor institute of systems and robotics dept. of electrical and computer engineering university of coimbra universidade de coimbra - p?lo ii 3030-290 coimbra,  portugal  e-mail: rprocha[at]isr.uc./ rprocha[at]deec.uc./ rui.rocha[at]uc.tel.: +351 239 796 256 skype: rprocha web: home.deec.uc.pt/~rprocha _______ founded in 1290, the university of coimbra (uc) is the oldest portuguese university and one of the oldest in the world. uc is nowadays a vibrant academy and an indisputable reference in higher education and research in  portugal  and in europe, due to the quality of the courses taught at its eight faculties and to its excellence in the promotion of science and technology advances in 46 research units integrated in the university. with more than 1,500 researchers and professors, uc has extensive experience in research programs with competitive research funding, particularly in european commission (ec) framework programs for research, in several areas including sciences, engineering, health, justice and home affairs, international cooperation, and mobility. in fp7, uc participated in 59 projects and was the coordinator in 10 of them. since the beginning of h2020, uc has participated in 20 project applications that were approved for funding, being the coordinator in 5 of them. the institute of systems and robotics - university of coimbra (isr-uc) is a research unit integrated in uc whose overall goal is to develop excellent research in various areas of science and technology, with emphasis on intelligent systems and robotics. the isr-uc has participated in over a dozen european projects funded by ec. the artificial perception for intelligent systems and robotics (ap4isr) team of isr-uc has participated in several ec-funded projects, both in fp6 (projects bacs and irps), fp7 (projects prometheus, handle, and social robot), and h2020 (project growmeup) framework programmes. the ap4isr team has been doing research in collaboration with important european players in excellence research from universities, research institutions, and companies (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__ap.isr.uc.pt_-3fw-3dpartners&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=l4eg2gxvqied0jmkzvf3vnarzfaxfgfnpfcllb8i7wa&s=nufozkcnuln3edpmeq3xhb7vixyndcvthd9zjqscgj4&e=), mostly from europe.

subject: research engineer position available at  isr - university of coimbra,   portugal  - artificial perception for multi-robot surveillance of  infrastructures in-reply-to: <361634640.1220083.1516697305364.javamail.zimbra@isr.uc.pt> references: <361634640.1220083.1516697305364.javamail.zimbra@isr.uc.pt>
content: (please redistribute; apologies for cross-postings)  --------------------------------------------------------------------  research engineer position at isr - university of coimbra,  portugal   topics: artificial perception, machine learning, semantic mapping,  cooperative perception, multi-robot surveillance of infrastructures.  application deadline: february 7, 2018 (hard deadline)  --------------------------------------------------------------------  one research engineer position is available at institute of systems and robotics - university of coimbra (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__ap.isr.uc.pt_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=zoxpraslo7n4kgsm5wobcw7mlpfucftojqrjjfbk4mm&s=rzi8zqcwqz8anmrpll2a-mjk5-1if-f1nnyfswwvyge&e=),  portugal , starting in march 2018, under the supervision of prof. rui p. rocha, in the scope of the project ?stop ? cooperative robotic securities?, funded by the ? portugal  2020? (pt2020) program, co-funded by the european regional development fund (erdf). the project stop aims at pursuing research on automatic patrolling of infrastructures by mobile robots, and developing innovative technical features in order to adapt the intended multi-robot systems to real scenarios, namely the automatic perception of security threats and other abnormal situations, as well as the resilient operation during long periods of time. the research engineer will integrate a multidisciplinary research team involved in several nationally and internationally funded excellence research programs.  the candidates must hold a m.sc. degree in electrical and computer engineering, or in computer science engineering, **obtained in a university located in a country that adhered to the european higher education area (a.k.a. bolonha declaration), in canada, or in usa**. the ideal candidate would have excellent software development skills in c++ and linux os, solid experience in software development for robots using ros (robot operating system), experience in pattern recognition and machine learning, excellent interpersonal and teamwork skills, and be eager to get involved in the project stop. besides these core competencies, knowledge and experience on mobile robotics and computer vision will also be valued.  application procedure  applicants must send by email the following mandatory documents:  i) digital copy of the m.sc. academic degree certificate;  ii) curriculum vitae (cv), including gpa for academic degrees, curricula of the b.sc. and m.sc. courses, and title of the m.sc. dissertation;  iii) motivation letter - the candidate must demonstrate her/his total availability to start working in isr - university of coimbra on early march 2018.  important notice: candidates who did not obtain their m.sc. degree in  portugal  are obliged to present records of the equivalence/recognition of the m.sc. diploma in  portugal , issued by the directorate-general for higher education or by a portuguese public higher education establishment, according with the information at:  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.uc.pt_en_academicos_provas_equivalencia&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=zoxpraslo7n4kgsm5wobcw7mlpfucftojqrjjfbk4mm&s=minw-ahx08nsxpqlujov6hr9hmfhml1icj4i4rxf4qy&e=  for candidates who are still waiting for the end of this recognition process, at least a proof that a request for the diploma recognition is being processed by the academic services of university of coimbra (e.g. an email from official services) must be included in the application.  the following optional documents can be sent together with the aforementioned documents:  - certificates of the participation in face-to-face courses, workshops, and summer schools related with ros, pattern recognition, machine learning, and mobile robotics;  - reference letters and contact information of current or previous supervisors for candidates having past experience in r&d projects;  - other relevant documentation, e.g. a digital copy of the m.sc. dissertation.  since the two applicants having the best curriculum will be interviewed in mid-feb. 2018 before the winning candidate is selected, every applicant should provide the skype nickname in the contact information included in the cv.  the application must be sent in pdf format to rui.rocha[at]uc.pt, with the subject ?research engineer position in project stop?, *no later than february 7, 2018*.  ______  rui p. rocha, ph.d.  assistant professor  institute of systems and robotics  dept. of electrical and computer engineering  university of coimbra  universidade de coimbra - subject: postdoctoral position in robot  perception (polytechnique montreal)
content: dear roboticists, the mist laboratory (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__mistlab.ca&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=n4kn6wdejtzu6tbo9cs1ecqkchk9juldtcw4lo03z_w&s=fe0sf0tujoniqzmvwgza8mkwj-6ug21wxev9loofr6s&e=), in the computer engineering department of polytechnique, on the university of montreal campus, is taking applications a 2-year postdoctoral position in robotics in the context of a large (8m$) project involving the use of robots for disaster response (our research in 60 seconds: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__youtu.be_zawbxiaykvy&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=n4kn6wdejtzu6tbo9cs1ecqkchk9juldtcw4lo03z_w&s=34xx97etrctmtin0s4xkca3aoohbga1ouh45b95dai0&e=). successful candidates will have the chance to work in a stimulating environment, in a lab with top of the line equipment and robots, in close collaboration with industrial partners, with a competitive salary. in addition, montreal is becoming a world reference for artificial intelligence and robotics, as well as being a lively, beautiful, and affordable city. salary is set at 50k$/year (including social benefits). in particular we are looking for the an individual who would work on the customization of the flying robots used in the project to improve perception: information gathering, classification, sensor fusion, visual navigation. this will include selecting sensors and algorithms to provide robots and operators with proper situational awareness. to apply, please refer to the instructions on https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__mistlab.ca_join&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=n4kn6wdejtzu6tbo9cs1ecqkchk9juldtcw4lo03z_w&s=pvpvnytuvgpcopkrdylactkqwjuqdvf06zw-u9x5ago&e=. note that due to federal regulations, only applicants within 5 years of their phd can be considered. best regards, -- giovanni beltrame, phd, ing. mist lab - mistlab.ca ecole polytechnique de montreal visiting professor - university of t?bingen

subject: research engineer position available at  isr - university of coimbra,   portugal  - artificial perception for multi-robot surveillance of  infrastructures in-reply-to: <1021943098.1363030.1517212574560.javamail.zimbra@isr.uc.pt> references: <361634640.1220083.1516697305364.javamail.zimbra@isr.uc.pt>  <1211420841.1224262.1516701117454.javamail.zimbra@isr.uc.pt>  <1021943098.1363030.1517212574560.javamail.zimbra@isr.uc.pt>
content: (please redistribute; apologies for cross-postings)  --------------------------------------------------------------------  research engineer position at isr - university of coimbra,  portugal   topics: artificial perception, machine learning, semantic mapping,  cooperative perception, multi-robot surveillance of infrastructures.  application deadline: february 7, 2018 (hard deadline)  --------------------------------------------------------------------  one research engineer position is available at institute of systems and robotics - university of coimbra (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__ap.isr.uc.pt_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=mybiciiuihf2wrthachrnqs8z6vqvtfojtaa3oodv-m&s=u4qjtuzzgychkdq9xji4pse_y4_pg8qeowtbcgvebcm&e=),  portugal , starting in march 2018, under the supervision of prof. rui p. rocha, in the scope of the project ?stop ? cooperative robotic securities?, funded by the ? portugal  2020? (pt2020) program, co-funded by the european regional development fund (erdf). the project stop aims at pursuing research on automatic patrolling of infrastructures by mobile robots, and developing innovative technical features in order to adapt the intended multi-robot systems to real scenarios, namely the automatic perception of security threats and other abnormal situations, as well as the resilient operation during long periods of time. the research engineer will integrate a multidisciplinary research team involved in several nationally and internationally funded excellence research programs.  the candidates must hold a m.sc. degree in electrical and computer engineering, or in computer science engineering, **obtained in a university located in a country that adhered to the european higher education area (a.k.a. bolonha declaration), in canada, or in usa**. the ideal candidate would have excellent software development skills in c++ and linux os, solid experience in software development for robots using ros (robot operating system), experience in pattern recognition and machine learning, excellent interpersonal and teamwork skills, and be eager to get involved in the project stop. besides these core competencies, knowledge and experience on mobile robotics and computer vision will also be valued.  application procedure  applicants must send by email the following mandatory documents:  i) digital copy of the m.sc. academic degree certificate;  ii) curriculum vitae (cv), including gpa for academic degrees, curricula of the b.sc. and m.sc. courses, and title of the m.sc. dissertation;  iii) motivation letter - the candidate must demonstrate her/his total availability to start working in isr - university of coimbra on early march 2018.  important notice: candidates who did not obtain their m.sc. degree in  portugal  are obliged to present records of the equivalence/recognition of the m.sc. diploma in  portugal , issued by the directorate-general for higher education or by a portuguese public higher education establishment, according with the information at:  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.uc.pt_en_academicos_provas_equivalencia&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=mybiciiuihf2wrthachrnqs8z6vqvtfojtaa3oodv-m&s=mtz8fklagju0bvrun02steh5cgfgj1xwdknq_rmlu2o&e=  for candidates who are still waiting for the end of this recognition process, at least a proof that a request for the diploma recognition is being processed by the academic services of university of coimbra (e.g. an email from official services) must be included in the application.  the following optional documents can be sent together with the aforementioned documents:  - certificates of the participation in face-to-face courses, workshops, and summer schools related with ros, pattern recognition, machine learning, and mobile robotics;  - reference letters and contact information of current or previous supervisors for candidates having past experience in r&d projects;  - other relevant documentation, e.g. a digital copy of the m.sc. dissertation.  since the two applicants having the best curriculum will be interviewed in mid-feb. 2018 before the winning candidate is selected, every applicant should provide the skype nickname in the contact information included in the cv.  the application must be sent in pdf format to rui.rocha[at]uc.pt, with the subject ?research engineer position in project stop?, *no later than february 7, 2018*.  ______  rui p. rocha, ph.d.  assistant professor  institute of systems and robotics  dept. of electrical and computer engineering  university of coimbra  universidade de coimbra - p?lo ii  3030-290 coimbra,  portugal   e-mail: rprocha[at]isr.uc./ rprocha[at]deec.uc./ rui.rocha[at]uc. tel.: +351 239 796 256  skype: rprocha  web: home.deec.uc.pt/~rprocha  _______  founded in 1290, the university of coimbra (uc) is the oldest portuguese university and one of the oldest in the world. uc is nowadays a vibrant academy and an indisputable reference in higher education and research in  portugal  and in europe, due to the quality of the courses taught at its eight faculties and to its excellence in the promotion of science and technology advances in 46 research units integrated in the university. with more than 1,500 researchers and professors, uc has extensive experience in research programs with competitive research funding, particularly in european commission (ec) framework programs for research, in several areas including sciences, engineering, health, justice and home affairs, international cooperation, and mobility. in fp7, uc participated in 59 projects and was the coordinator in 10 of them. since the beginning of h2020, uc has participated in 20 project applications that were approved for funding, being the coordinator in 5 of them.  the institute of systems and robotics - university of coimbra (isr-uc) is a research unit integrated in uc whose overall goal is to develop excellent research in various areas of science and technology, with emphasis on intelligent systems and robotics. the isr-uc has participated in over a dozen european projects funded by ec. the artificial perception for intelligent systems and robotics (ap4isr) team of isr-uc has participated in several ec-funded projects, both in fp6 (projects bacs and irps), fp7 (projects prometheus, handle, and social robot), and h2020 (project growmeup) framework programmes. the ap4isr team has been doing research in collaboration with important european players in excellence research from universities, research institutions, and companies (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__ap.isr.uc.pt_-3fw-3dpartners&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=mybiciiuihf2wrthachrnqs8z6vqvtfojtaa3oodv-m&s=dayj5ysjxxed1rr1npejcwteactoismhmzia7lod7kq&e=

subject: open phd and master positions in  robotics at morelab.org, canada
content: the morelab.org <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__morelab.org_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hl561fj4dzliwi3cfie0d16zoflkuoubj14hygfgiyg&s=zcju7umlhq5bdtx9oxaydwd-fuigqvmmdk-jwonyy5i&e=> has open phd and master positions with full scholarship. applicants with backgrounds in robotics, control engineering, robot vision and ai are welcome. research interests and achievements in socially aware robotics, sensor and data fusion, motion planning and control, and machine learning are preferable. practical experiences and skills in ros and matlab are required for these positions. feel free to contact the lab director (morelab.org at gmail.com) for more information. please send your cv, degrees, samples of your research works along with a research statement explaining your research experiences and achievements. our recent works for your references: toward socially aware robot navigation in dynamic and crowded environments: a proactive social motion model <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__ieeexplore.ieee.org_abstract_document_8011466_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hl561fj4dzliwi3cfie0d16zoflkuoubj14hygfgiyg&s=5jo-lka2wo0l66eum5y87kn9d3jsluacofqpvsr05-u&e=>, xt truong, td ngo, ieee transactions on automation science and engineering 14 (4), 1743-1760 dynamic social zone based mobile robot navigation for human comfortable safety in social environments <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__link.springer.com_article_10.1007_s12369-2d016-2d0352-2d0&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hl561fj4dzliwi3cfie0d16zoflkuoubj14hygfgiyg&s=jmbpgszv5i-f7e9pszngwofu-pwbznbo4afaoruftn8&e=>, xt truong, td ngo, international journal of social robotics 8 (5), 663-684. ?to approach humans??: a unified framework for approaching pose prediction and socially aware robot navigation <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__ieeexplore.ieee.org_stamp_stamp.jsp-3ftp-3d-26arnumber-3d8036225&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hl561fj4dzliwi3cfie0d16zoflkuoubj14hygfgiyg&s=02l_cvje3otow0aebeqyrfwn_joagfhazricxcrmh98&e=>, xt truong, td ngo, ieee transaction on cognitive and developmental systems. our demonstrations: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.youtube.com_user_themorethanone_videos&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hl561fj4dzliwi3cfie0d16zoflkuoubj14hygfgiyg&s=fzpdvd3-vp4px2cd8ipr7c9ix6vaz4ykspn3nuqgpiw&e= thanks, trung dung ngo

subject: canada excellence research chair in  human-centred robotics and machine intelligence
content: canada excellence research chair in human-centred robotics and machine intelligence https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__uwaterloo.ca_engineering_faculty-2dand-2dstaff_faculty-2dpositions-23canada-2dexcellence-2dresearch-2dchair-2din-2dhuman-2dcentered-2drobotics&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=qgffpxclii3nk8pildut5vkoz-xoobl2j2iyq4-nqus&s=wgvik8zsehd2uwkh7aurtlu1g8w_zyzztezqqclvdl8&e=  the university of waterloo has developed one of canada's largest and most active robotics and intelligent systems research groups (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__uwaterloo.ca_robotics-2dresearch&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=qgffpxclii3nk8pildut5vkoz-xoobl2j2iyq4-nqus&s=99mwo0ngtevfjx1ljutes9j-3v6dbhwcg11_vq6kypg&e=). our researchers are conducting fundamental research into neural networks, autonomous systems and human-machine interaction, while developing robots that can drive cars, defuse land mines, and perform surgery.  the cerc opportunity waterloo has been selected to nominate a prestigious 7 year canada excellence research chair in human-centred robotics and machine intelligence. the successful nominee will be appointed to a full-time tenured position, ideally at the rank of full professor, within waterloo's renowned faculty of engineering. canada excellence research chair (cerc) (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.cerc.gc.ca&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=qgffpxclii3nk8pildut5vkoz-xoobl2j2iyq4-nqus&s=3se6fxnhskca3n2ovlo-kvyvz1fh0vgsarkkpoylggo&e=) awards are among the most prestigious and generous research chairs awarded globally. the successful nominee will be supported by a $10 million grant from the government of canada, matched by an equal commitment from the university. they will be joined by at least six additional permanent faculty hires over the next five years, all working to pioneer scientific discovery, technology development and ip creation in this critical area. exceptional candidates the cerc candidate will be an exceptional researcher with a proven track record of discovery and innovation. they will have demonstrated a clear ability to lead, manage and grow multi-institutional and multidisciplinary research collaborations, and develop strong relationships with partners in related academic fields and in government and industry. they will be committed to excellence in supervision, mentorship and research training, and enthusiastic about communicating their research to audiences beyond academia. they will also be committed to the values of equity, diversity and inclusion - key ingredients for successful innovation. the successful candidate will propose an ambitious frontier program of high-quality research within the broad area of human-centred robotics and machine intelligence. the program will explore new ways to create intelligent machines, capable of operating safely, efficiently and dependably alongside people. solving these challenges will require a sustained and collaborative academic effort at the intersection of many fields of study.  the chair's research program may focus on fields including, but not limited to: *	intelligence *	autonomy *	machine vision *	machine learning	  *	human-machine interaction *	multi-robot systems *	advanced robotics and sensing *	neuromorphic engineering exceptional researchers from around the world are encouraged to apply - the program imposes no restrictions on nominees with regard to nationality or country of residence. candidates should hold a phd in engineering, computer science or a closely related field. the ideal candidate would be a full professor, but in exceptional cases associate professors who are expected to be promoted to the full professor level within one or two years of the nomination will also be considered. alternatively, if they come from outside the academic sector, nominees must possess the necessary qualifications to be appointed at these levels. the successful nominee will take up their position on or after july 1, 2019.  the university of waterloo respects, appreciates and encourages diversity and is committed to accessibility for persons with disabilities. we particularly welcome applications from women, members of visible minorities, indigenous/aboriginal peoples and persons with disabilities. all qualified candidates are encouraged to apply; however, canadian citizens and permanent residents will be given priority in the recruitment process. state-of-the-art environment for research and collaboration waterloo is ranked #1 for engineering in canada and #15 for computer science globally (u.s. news and world report 2018). our robotics research leads canada for citations and for research impact (thomson reuters web of science); our ai research is ranked top 5 in north america for citation impact (the world university rankings). these strengths will be reinforced in fall 2018, with the opening of waterloo's robohub (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__uwaterloo.ca_robohub&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=qgffpxclii3nk8pildut5vkoz-xoobl2j2iyq4-nqus&s=c7esikvvv9l7_aokdqzjmssn69oi5wxk8ymrms7jc0c&e=): a two-storey 100m2 experimental robotics arena in the heart of the new engineering 7 building, supporting research into robot coordination, autonomy, and human-robot interaction. our robotics teams collaborate extensively with waterloo's leading groups in artificial intelligence (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__uwaterloo.ca_operational-2dartificial-2dintelligence-2dresearch&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=qgffpxclii3nk8pildut5vkoz-xoobl2j2iyq4-nqus&s=jxzoypt0we_simjv3qwhpynese-pysxjpgwovhwdmwm&e=), automotive autonomy (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__uwaterloo.ca_autonomous-2dconnected-2dcar-2dresearch&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=qgffpxclii3nk8pildut5vkoz-xoobl2j2iyq4-nqus&s=xeu0bgk4w4edl-5wjzfyhlcydef_unyno38j2yzaona&e=), and healthy aging (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.the-2dria.ca&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=qgffpxclii3nk8pildut5vkoz-xoobl2j2iyq4-nqus&s=0ldaqe5656d-y1f4wwokz5a6r9bp4qq9fxie9sq7bgu&e=). eight of waterloo's canada research chairs work in these areas, alongside a younger cohort that includes ten recipients of ontario's early researcher awards. three more reasons to apply: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__uwaterloo.ca_faculty-2dassociation_why-2dwaterloo&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=qgffpxclii3nk8pildut5vkoz-xoobl2j2iyq4-nqus&s=wlxvquzlvi2uo0pmpio4cscbh9jbn0-0hkphmtordfi&e=. waterloo as an innovation hub the university of waterloo has been recognized as canada's most innovative university for the past 26 straight years. we are a key academic partner in two of canada's recently launched innovation superclusters: scale.ai (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.ic.gc.ca_eic_site_093.nsf_eng_00009.html&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=qgffpxclii3nk8pildut5vkoz-xoobl2j2iyq4-nqus&s=ockpvw1jcxe7n5dfuopnate_ef9urnyhtrrwpixzeia&e=), defining a new, ai-powered global supply chain platform; and ngm canada (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.ic.gc.ca_eic_site_093.nsf_eng_00010.html&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=qgffpxclii3nk8pildut5vkoz-xoobl2j2iyq4-nqus&s=x4kmd6y6utuo2dfluynlicq_kmvuei906c90ikrpxhy&e=), driving collaboration between the technology and manufacturing sectors.  *	waterloo's "inventor-owned" intellectual property (ip) policy allows researchers complete freedom to disseminate and commercialize their research as they see fit. all ip originating from students, faculty or staff remain the property of the innovator - not the university.  *	waterloo is one of the world's leading universities for the creation of unicorns (billion dollar companies), ranked 4th in the world (pitchbook 2017).  *	engineering students and faculty have launched over 650 new companies, spurring waterloo region towards the 2nd highest start-up density in the world after silicon valley (compass report 2016). how to apply for more information: interested candidates are encouraged to contact pearl sullivan, dean of engineering, for more information at dean.engineering at uwaterloo.ca. to apply: please send a curriculum vitae and a statement of interest in the position, in confidence, to dr. charmaine dean, vice-president university research, at vpresearch at uwaterloo.ca. review of applications will begin on may 1, 2018, and will continue until the position is filled.

(https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__uwaterloo.ca_operational-2dartificial-2dintelligence-2dresearch&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hdfxfa03zpypaq8mberhregujktfitzv5ckaiqkgen8&s=gz7ietysbfnenqqae663nm-vlsqfsyheqxsvkh_pzjw&e=), automotive autonomy (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__uwaterloo.ca_autonomous-2dconnected-2dcar-2dresearch&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hdfxfa03zpypaq8mberhregujktfitzv5ckaiqkgen8&s=xhanprkiqd2dqtghhvwsde1iejtcgj85brs4oga4soc&e=), and healthy aging (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.the-2dria.ca&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hdfxfa03zpypaq8mberhregujktfitzv5ckaiqkgen8&s=ftzg-_92sbqs9v1n5ynq422ltoeigt-qfnb00as3-ek&e=). eight of waterloo's canada research chairs work in these areas, alongside a younger cohort that includes ten recipients of ontario's early researcher awards. three more reasons to apply: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__uwaterloo.ca_faculty-2dassociation_why-2dwaterloo&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hdfxfa03zpypaq8mberhregujktfitzv5ckaiqkgen8&s=k_bptdiszce0uohpgsz5vrpudy-rj1ptm4o83zvmq4e&e=. waterloo as an innovation hub the university of waterloo has been recognized as canada's most innovative university for the past 26 straight years. we are a key academic partner in two of canada's recently launched innovation superclusters: scale.ai (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.ic.gc.ca_eic_site_093.nsf_eng_00009.html&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hdfxfa03zpypaq8mberhregujktfitzv5ckaiqkgen8&s=iovwwnihacozmeynvvkwfpuz0ts7sado6_oznzlqqp0&e=), defining a new, ai-powered global supply chain platform; and ngm canada (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.ic.gc.ca_eic_site_093.nsf_eng_00010.html&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hdfxfa03zpypaq8mberhregujktfitzv5ckaiqkgen8&s=nu-ba8raese1fqrqrwd4lazzqmk1s2rscb-tdibycxy&e=), driving collaboration between the technology and manufacturing sectors.  * waterloo's "inventor-owned" intellectual property (ip) policy allows researchers complete freedom to disseminate and commercialize their research as they see fit. all ip originating from students, faculty or staff remain the property of the innovator - not the university.  * waterloo is one of the world's leading universities for the creation of unicorns (billion dollar companies), ranked 4th in the world (pitchbook 2017).  * engineering students and faculty have launched over 650 new companies, spurring waterloo region towards the 2nd highest start-up density in the world after silicon valley (compass report 2016). how to apply for more information: interested candidates are encouraged to contact pearl sullivan, dean of engineering, for more information at dean.engineering at uwaterloo.ca. to apply: please send a curriculum vitae and a statement of interest in the position, in confidence, to dr. charmaine dean, vice-president university research, at vpresearch at uwaterloo.ca. review of applications will begin on may 1, 2018, and will continue until the position is filled.

subject: icra 2018 access to talent program -  talk with top robotics companies about opportunities while at icra! free  with registration!
content: ************************************************** call for participation access to talent program at icra 2018 https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__icra2018.org_access-2dto-2dtalent-2dprogram-2dat-2dicra2018_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ababgtizkw6kcjnl8c5quzaoehtctqg3etv8dv_jk84&s=jx4khbbbhppesprnece16m1zquzruzmfsia2vklkdvy&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__icra2018.org_access-2dto-2dtalent-2dprogram-2dat-2dicra2018_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ababgtizkw6kcjnl8c5quzaoehtctqg3etv8dv_jk84&s=jx4khbbbhppesprnece16m1zquzruzmfsia2vklkdvy&e=> may 21-25, 2018, brisbane austrialia ************************************************** looking for a job in robotics? looking to hire top robotics job candidates? after previous successes at icra and iros, the ieee robotics and automation society will again be organizing an official access to talent program in conjunction with icra 2018. this program is targeted at job seekers and robotics companies of all sizes. it provides an outstanding opportunity for potential employers and potential employees to connect at one of the top robotics conferences in the world. the program will be of interest to: (1) those seeking employment opportunities conference attendees (including students) interested in robotics-related employment opportunities may upload their contact information, interests and resum? to a database that will be made available to company recruiters. interested companies will then have the opportunity to review the database and conduct on-site interviews with you at icra! an outstanding group of companies and organisations have already signed up to participate and will be actively recruiting at the conference! these include:   	?         artisense 	?         baidu 	?         csiro 	?         dji 	?         kuka 	?         nutonomy 	?         uber   many more are joining as we speak!  don?t wait! take advantage of this fantastic chance to connect and launch your robotics career! there is no cost to upload your resum? to the database. instructions for uploading your information are included in the registration confirmation email for icra 2018. (2) recruiting companies companies interested in recruiting at icra 2018 will have access to the following resources: - a searchable resume database of conference attendees interested in robotics-related employment. - space for conducting on-site interviews. - poster space during the exhibition to advertise the company and its available positions. more information is available at https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__icra2018.org_access-2dto-2dtalent-2dprogram-2dat-2dicra2018_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ababgtizkw6kcjnl8c5quzaoehtctqg3etv8dv_jk84&s=jx4khbbbhppesprnece16m1zquzruzmfsia2vklkdvy&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__icra2018.org_access-2dto-2dtalent-2dprogram-2dat-2dicra2018_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ababgtizkw6kcjnl8c5quzaoehtctqg3etv8dv_jk84&s=jx4khbbbhppesprnece16m1zquzruzmfsia2vklkdvy&e=>.  email inquires may be directed to: accesstalent at ieee.org <mailto:accesstalent at ieee.org>. organizing committee -------------------------------- henny admoni, carnegie mellon university, usa matthew walter, toyota technological institute, usa jonathan kelly, university of toronto, canada

subject: post-doc: robotics for advanced  manufacturing and logistics
content: waterloo engineering has the largest and one of the most active research groups on robotics and factory automation in canada (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__uwaterloo.ca_robotics-2dresearch_&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=6h5jg-yu0wmecyqzcsrnn1t9v-4kvmrmlcknwa_5fao&s=ntol5e1lws2didshydum73gbheqkdgild0brxgd7tji&e=). with over 45 faculty members and the state-of-the-art test facility including robohub (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__uwaterloo.ca_robohub_&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=6h5jg-yu0wmecyqzcsrnn1t9v-4kvmrmlcknwa_5fao&s=jq1gillfvn8mc6fd-p_slmnaneh55dizk8djqjfvye4&e=), waterloo robotics research team has a wide breadth of expertise in all areas of advanced robotics, factory automation and complementary fields. we are currently looking for a post-doctoral fellow (pdf) to join the department of mechanical & mechatronics engineering (mme) and electrical & computer engineering (ece) at university of waterloo, canada. any qualified personnel are encouraged to apply. general information - topic: human-oriented operation of mobile manipulators for advanced manufacturing and logistics. - duration: the initial appointment will be one year with a potential renewal for another year (i.e. maximum two years). - start date: any time within 2018 (or as soon as the position is filled) - faculty members in charge: soo jeon (mme), dana kulic (ece) and william melek (mme) at university of waterloo, canada minimum requirement - phd in mechanical, electrical, computer or similar engineering disciplines - demonstrated research expertise in robotics, dynamic systems, control and estimation - experience with ros (robot operating system) for autonomous navigation and/or robotic manipulation desired skills - experience with robotic vision and machine learning - experience with human-robot interaction (hri) responsibilities - conducting independent research through theoretical, numerical and experimental studies, and disseminating the results through publications - overlooking and managing experimental platforms (mobile platforms and robotic arms) - assisting faculty members with project management and supervising graduate students (6  ~ 7 masc+phd students). application process - send your cv to soo jeon at soojeon at uwaterloo.ca<mailto:soojeon at uwaterloo.ca> with the subject "[uw mme postdoc application]". additional information - for general info on the postdoctoral appointment process, please visit https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__uwaterloo.ca_postdoctoral-2daffairs_&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=6h5jg-yu0wmecyqzcsrnn1t9v-4kvmrmlcknwa_5fao&s=gurxesh-ekuiv69y7cdxwufjdcjg6f7f8ukirghr50e&e=. - soo jeon and dana kulic will be at icra 2018 in may, and will be available to meet any interested candidates. soo jeon associate professor mechanical & mechatronics engineering university of waterloo, canada

subject: faculty position in ee / machine  learning at polytechnique montreal
content: polytechnique montreal is seeking applicants for a tenure-track faculty position with the department of electrical engineering, at the assistant or associate professor level. this position falls within the application areas of the institute for data valorization (ivado, https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__ivado.ca_en_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=_sot8yzjlnnwc_-ors-lid7z_o5b43_ochzgnfwmikq&s=0ooj3i1pnutbt1n8o3b9w8hp4nvlh6d-dmgw0xq4uos&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__ivado.ca_en_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=_sot8yzjlnnwc_-ors-lid7z_o5b43_ochzgnfwmikq&s=0ooj3i1pnutbt1n8o3b9w8hp4nvlh6d-dmgw0xq4uos&e=>), an academic initiative bringing together researchers form hec montr?al, polytechnique montr?al and the universit? de montr?al. the successful candidate will receive support from ivado and its members.  relevant areas include robotics, machine learning, ai, optimization, etc., with applications connected to electrical engineering, such as: - cyberphysical systems, e.g., machine based perception in robotics and autonomous systems; analysis of massive sensor data for anomaly detection, system vulnerability and failure characterization; data-driven learning of high performance control schemes;  - electrical networks, e.g., data-based learning of the aggregate behavior of renewable energy sources; anticipation of vulnerable system states and data based learning and identification of corrective actions; disaggregation of loads based on smart meter and substation provided data. - communications systems, e.g., machine learning for optimal usage of the frequency spectrum in cognitive radio; learning of internet traffic to improve network structure and routing algorithms, to increase communication speed and to decrease energy usage (green internet); data based speech and signal processing. - medical image analysis using artificial intelligence and machine learning algorithms, integration of genomic, proteomic, metabolomic data with clinical image analysis, big data science applied to medical imaging, etc. start date: september 2018. instructions on how to apply can be found here: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.polymtl.ca_carriere_en_offres-2ddemploi_electrical-2dengineering-2dprofessor-2ddata-2dscience-2ddeep-2dlearning-2dreinforcement-2dlearning-2divado&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=_sot8yzjlnnwc_-ors-lid7z_o5b43_ochzgnfwmikq&s=ko_h5cfe8iimy4l_wlpfrepvjfqlp6ulti9r3u7sgmw&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.polymtl.ca_carriere_en_offres-2ddemploi_electrical-2dengineering-2dprofessor-2ddata-2dscience-2ddeep-2dlearning-2dreinforcement-2dlearning-2divado&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=_sot8yzjlnnwc_-ors-lid7z_o5b43_ochzgnfwmikq&s=ko_h5cfe8iimy4l_wlpfrepvjfqlp6ulti9r3u7sgmw&e=> note: although knowledge of french is not a prerequisite, faculty are expected to be able to teach and work in french after 2 years (and are provided with support to help them reach this objective). -- jerome le ny		 associate professor department of electrical engineering | phone: +1 (514) 340 4711, x4886          polytechnique montreal & gerad office: a-429.13 (main building)     | lab:
